bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to L. O. Howard, March 25, 1922

div1.p: LePrince sends the remaining mosquitoes hatched from pupae and larvae found in a hotel in Carbondale, Illinois.

div1.head: Letter from Joseph A. LePrince to L. O. Howard, March 25, 1922
div1.opener:
F.I. - Malaria
Room 17, Court House
Book
Le P.
JC
HEADQUARTERS:
Field Investigations of Malaria
U.S. Public Health Service,
Memphis, Tenn.
March 25, 1922.
Dr. L. O. Howard, Chief,
Bureau of Entomology,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Howard:
div1.p:
I am mailing you today the remainder of
the mosquitoes that emerged from the collection of
pupae and larvae collected by Mr. E. H. Gage at
Carbondale, Illinois, in the Hotel Roberts on
March 15, 1922. There are five of them. I mailed
you a previous lot of adults from the same lot of
pupae in a grey card-board box.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. A. LePrince, Senior Sanitary Engineer.
cc: Dr. H. R. Carter.
FOR YOUR INFORMATION
